REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.contacts.repository.apply_contact_filters(stmt, limit: int, skip: int, days: int, email, fullname, db: AsyncSession)¶

Apply filters to the contact query based on the provided parameters including pagination, upcoming birthdays, email, and fullname.

Parameters:

  • stmt (SQLAlchemy Select object) – The SQL statement to add the filters to.

  • limit (int) – The number of contacts to return.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • days (int) – How many days ahead to look for future birthdays.

  • email (str) – The email of the contact to search for.

  • fullname (str) – The full name of the contact to search for.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of filtered contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.contacts.repository.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact¶

Create a new contact for the given user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The data for the new contact

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session

  • user (User) – The user object containing the user’s details

Returns:

The created contact object

Return type:

Contact

async src.contacts.repository.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Delete a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The id of the contact to delete

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact

Returns:

The deleted contact or None if not found

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

async src.contacts.repository.get_all_contacts(limit: int, skip: int, days: int, email, fullname, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶
Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The number of contacts to return

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip

  • days (int) – How many days ahead to look for future birthdays

  • email (str) – The email of the user

  • fullname (str) – The full name of the user

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session

  • user_id (int) – The id of the user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.contacts.repository.get_contact_by_email(stmt, email: str)¶

Filter contacts by email using a case-insensitive match.

Parameters:

  • stmt (SQLAlchemy Select object) – The SQL statement to add the filter to.

  • email (str) – The email of the contact to search for.

Returns:

The SQL statement with the added filter for contact email.

Return type:

SQLAlchemy Select object

async src.contacts.repository.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact¶

Retrieve a contact by its ID for a given user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session

  • user (User) – The user object containing the user’s details

Returns:

The contact object if found, otherwise None

Return type:

Contact

async src.contacts.repository.get_contact_by_name(stmt, contact_fullname: str)¶

Filter contacts by full name using a case-insensitive match.

Parameters:

  • stmt (SQLAlchemy Select object) – The SQL statement to add the filter to.

  • contact_fullname (str) – The full name of the contact to search for.

Returns:

The SQL statement with the added filter for contact full name.

Return type:

SQLAlchemy Select object

async src.contacts.repository.get_contact_for_upcoming_birthday(stmt, days: int)¶

Filter contacts by upcoming birthdays within a given number of days.

Parameters:

  • stmt (SQLAlchemy Select object) – The SQL statement to add the filter to.

  • days (int) – The number of days ahead to look for upcoming birthdays.

Returns:

The SQL statement with the added filter for upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

SQLAlchemy Select object

async src.contacts.repository.get_my_contacts(limit: int, skip: int, days: int, email, fullname, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve all contacts associated with the given user, applying filters for pagination, upcoming birthdays, email, and fullname.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The number of contacts to return

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip

  • days (int) – How many days ahead to look for future birthdays

  • email (str) – The email of the contact

  • fullname (str) – The full name of the contact

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session

  • user (User) – The user object containing the user’s details

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.contacts.repository.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Update a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The id of the contact to update

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The update schema for the contact

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact

Returns:

The updated contact or None if not found

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

User

async src.users.repository.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Update a user’s avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str | None) – The new avatar URL or None to clear it.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session (optional).

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.users.repository.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token or None to clear it.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • password (str) – The new password.

async static create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional expiration time in seconds.

Returns:

Create a JWT token for resetting the password.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional expiration time in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded JWT token.

Return type:

str

async static decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Decode a JWT refresh token to extract the email.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The JWT refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email encoded inside the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the scope is not ‘refresh_token’.

async static get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Get the current user from the provided JWT token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token to decode.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

Returns:

The user associated with the email in the token.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user is not found.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token to decode.

Returns:

The email encoded inside the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

Hash the provided password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

async static is_active(token: str) → None¶

Check if a JWT token is active (valid).

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token to validate.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

Raises:

JWTError – If the token is invalid.

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verify that the provided plain text password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API repository Auth¶

async src.services.auth.repository.send_reset_password_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, temp_code: str, host: str)¶

Sends a password reset email to a user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • temp_code (str) – The temporary code for password reset.

  • host (str) – The host URL for email links.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If any connection error occurs during the email sending process.

async src.services.auth.repository.send_verify_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends a verification email to a user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – The host URL for email links.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If any connection error occurs during the email sending process.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.contacts.routes_users.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The contact data to create.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponseSchema

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact already exists, raises a 409 error.

async src.contacts.routes_users.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

None

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found, raises a 409 error.

async src.contacts.routes_users.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.contacts.routes_users.get_contacts_by_filters(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), days_to_birthday: int = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), fullname: str = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts filtered by various criteria.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve (default 10, between 10 and 100).

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the result set (default 0).

  • days_to_birthday (int, optional) – Filter contacts by days remaining to their next birthday (optional).

  • email (str, optional) – Filter contacts by email or part of an email (optional).

  • fullname (str, optional) – Filter contacts by full name or part of a name (optional).

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of filtered contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponseSchema]

async src.contacts.routes_users.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated contact data.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponseSchema

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found, raises a 409 error.

REST API routes Contacts | Admin functions¶

async src.contacts.routes_admin.get_all_contacts_by_filters(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(None), days_to_birthday: int = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), fullname: str = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user_id: int = Query(None), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts based on provided filters.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve (default: 10, range: 10-100).

  • offset (int, optional) – Number of contacts to skip (default: None, must be >=0).

  • days_to_birthday (int, optional) – Filter contacts by number of days until their birthday (default: None, range: 0-365).

  • email (str, optional) – Filter contacts by full or part of an email address (default: None).

  • fullname (str, optional) – Filter contacts by full or part of a name (default: None).

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user_id (int, optional) – Filter contacts by specified user’s ID (default: None).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the specified filters.

Return type:

list[ContactResponseSchema]

REST API routes Users¶

async src.users.routes.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the current authenticated user’s avatar.

This endpoint allows the current authenticated user to update their avatar by uploading a new image file. The image is uploaded to Cloudinary, and the public URL is updated in the user’s profile.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The new avatar image file to be uploaded.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user, automatically injected by dependency.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session, automatically injected by dependency.

Returns:

The updated user details with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

User
